intro: Tetrapoma barbareifolium, commonly known as the mountain spurge, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, often in alpine environments. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are often covered in fine hairs. The plant is noted for its resilience to cold and harsh environmental conditions.
